full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 747 Filed 08/10/22 Page 188 of 228 864 LC2VMAX6 Alessi - Direct particular, I want to ask you some questions about the booklet that you saw during your employment for Mr. Epstein. So remind us, between what years did you work for Mr. Epstein? A. Around 1990 to 2002. Q. During that time, how often were new booklets printed? Or, excuse me, directories, directories is what I wanted to talk about. How often were new directories -- A. I think they were printed twice a year. Q. Did each directory have the names of current employees in it? A. Yes. Q. So when an employee left, was that employee's name still in the next version of the directory? A. No, because -- and the new directory you show me, my name is not -- Q. That's not my question, Mr. Alessi. That's not my question. My question is just in your experience looking at the different versions of directories that you saw, did the directories remove the names of employees who had left? A. Yes. Q. Okay. And did they add the names of my new employees who had come? A. Yes. Q. I want to talk about Government Exhibit 52, the same exhibit you reviewed last night. SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018061
